required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study to Evaluate Tear Characteristics Following Acute TrueTear™ Use
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Controlled, Single-Center, Cross-Over Clinical Study to Evaluate Tear Characteristics Following Acute TrueTear™ Use

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the change in tear meniscus height (TMH) produced by intranasal stimulation with TrueTear™ compared with the same device applied extranasally (control).

clinical_study.why_stopped: Based on interim review and decision to re-design the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline (Pre-application) in Tear Meniscus Height (TMH) at Eye Opening and Pre-Blink
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-application (Day 0) to time (T) 0 (immediately), 15, 30, 60, 120, 180, 240, 300 and 360 minutes on Day 0 after application
primary_outcome.description: Tear meniscus height is defined as the mean height of the lower tear prism to the edge of the eye lid measured by the investigator using the Tear scope Plus in conjunction with a Topcon SL-D7 slit lamp biomicroscope and high-resolution digital video recording. Change from Baseline to time (T) T0 (immediately), T15, T30, T60, T120, T180, T240, T300, T360 minutes (mins) after application was reported. A negative change from Baseline (Pre-application) indicates improvement.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline (Pre-application) in Tear Lipid Layer Thickness at Eye Opening and Pre-Blink
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-application (Day 0) to time (T) 0 (immediately), 15, 30, 60, 120, 180, 240, 300 and 360 minutes on Day 0 after application
primary_outcome.description: Lipid layer thickness is defined as the average thickness of the lipid layer calculated from the thickness of the various pattern weighted by the relative coverage of each pattern measured by the investigator using the Tearscope Plus in conjunction with a Topcon SL-D7 slit lamp biomicroscope and high-resolution digital video recording. Change from Baseline to T0 (immediately), T15, T30, T60, T120, T180, T240, T300, T360 mins after application was reported. A negative change from Baseline (Pre-application) indicates improvement .

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline (Pre-application) in Non-Invasive Tear Film Break-Up Time (NIBUT)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-application (Day 0) to time (T) 0 (immediately), 15, 30, 60, 120, 180, 240, 300 and 360 minutes on Day 0 after application
primary_outcome.description: Non-invasive break-up time is the time in seconds between eye opening and the appearance of the first visible break in the lipid layer of the pre-corneal tear film measured by the investigator using the Tearscope Plus in conjunction with a Topcon SL-D7 slit lamp biomicroscope and high-resolution digital video recording. Change from Baseline to T0 (immediately), T15, T30, T60, T120, T180, T240, T300, T360 mins after application was reported. A negative change from Baseline (Pre-application) indicates improvement.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Pre-application in Protective Index (PI)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-application (Day 0) to time (T) 0 (immediately), 15, 30, 60, 120, 180, 240, 300 and 360 minutes on Day 0 after application
primary_outcome.description: The Protected Index (PI) corresponds to the percentage of the corneal surface that is not exposed to the atmosphere (i.e. fully covered by the tear film) over the full interblink period measured by the investigator using a Tear scope Plus in conjunction with a Topcon SL-D7 slit lamp biomicroscope and high-resolution digital video recording. Change from Baseline to T0 (immediately), T15, T30, T60, T120, T180, T240, T300, T360 mins after application was reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Pre-application in Exposed Area (EA)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-application (Day 0) to time (T) 0 (immediately), 15, 30, 60, 120, 180, 240, 300 and 360 minutes on Day 0 after application
primary_outcome.description: Exposed Area is defined as the percentage of the observed area not covered by the tear film at the time of the blink hence exposed to the atmosphere measured by the investigator using a Tear scope Plus in conjunction with a Topcon SL-D7 slit lamp biomicroscope and high-resolution digital video recording. Change from Baseline to T0 (immediately), T15, T30, T60, T120, T180, T240, T300, T360 mins after application was reported.

arm_group.description: TrueTear™ device, intranasal (test) application, for approximately 3 minutes on Day 0 followed by TrueTear™ device, extranasal (control) application, for approximately 3 minutes on Day 14.
TrueTear™ device, extranasal (control) application, for approximately 3 minutes on Day 0 followed by TrueTear™ device, intranasal (test) application, for approximately 3 minutes on Day 14.

intervention.description: Intranasal and extranasal application of TrueTear™ device for approximately 3 minutes at Day 0 and Day 14.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Baseline Ocular Surface Disease Index© (OSDI©) score of at least 23 with no more than three responses of "not applicable"
- In at least one eye, a baseline Schirmer test of ≤ 10 mm/5 minutes AND a cotton swab nasal stimulation Schirmer test of at least 7 mm higher in the same eye
Exclusion Criteria:
- Chronic or recurrent epistaxis, coagulation disorders or other conditions that may increase the risk of bleeding
- History of nasal or sinus surgery
- Vascularized polyp, deviated septum or severe nasal airway obstruction at the Screening visit
- Intraocular and extraocular surgery in either eye within three months of the Screening Visit or refractive surgery within twelve months of the Screening Visit
- Cardiac demand pacemaker, implanted defibrillator, or other active implanted metallic or active implanted electronic device in the head

link.description: For information to locate a study location near you, please visit AllerganClinicalTrials.com

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: TrueTear™ Intranasal Then Extranasal Application
group.description: TrueTear™ device, intranasal (test) application, for approximately 3 minutes on Day 0 followed by TrueTear™ device, extranasal (control) application, for approximately 3 minutes on Day 14.

group.title: TrueTear™ Extranasal Then Intranasal Application
group.description: TrueTear™ device, extranasal (control) application, for approximately 3 minutes on Day 0 followed by TrueTear™ device, intranasal (test) application, for approximately 3 minutes on Day 14.

baseline.population: All participants who received TrueTear™ either intranasally or extranasally.

group.title: All Study Participants
group.description: All participants randomized to receive TrueTear™ device either intranasally (test) or extranasally (control) on Days 0 and 14.

measure.title: Age
measure.population: All participants randomized to receive TrueTear ™ device either intranasally or extranasally on Days 0 and 14.

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline (Pre-application) in Tear Meniscus Height (TMH) at Eye Opening and Pre-Blink
outcome.description: Tear meniscus height is defined as the mean height of the lower tear prism to the edge of the eye lid measured by the investigator using the Tear scope Plus in conjunction with a Topcon SL-D7 slit lamp biomicroscope and high-resolution digital video recording. Change from Baseline to time (T) T0 (immediately), T15, T30, T60, T120, T180, T240, T300, T360 minutes (mins) after application was reported. A negative change from Baseline (Pre-application) indicates improvement.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-application (Day 0) to time (T) 0 (immediately), 15, 30, 60, 120, 180, 240, 300 and 360 minutes on Day 0 after application
outcome.population: All participants who met the eligibility criteria, adhered to the protocol, and successfully completed the full study assessment were included in the per-protocol analysis.

group.title: TrueTear™ Extranasal Application
group.description: TrueTear™ device, extranasal (control) application, for approximately 3 minutes on Day 0 or Day 14.

group.title: TrueTear™ Intranasal Application
group.description: TrueTear™ device, intranasal (test) application, for approximately 3 minutes on Day 0 or Day 14.

measure.title: Change From Baseline (Pre-application) in Tear Meniscus Height (TMH) at Eye Opening and Pre-Blink
measure.description: Tear meniscus height is defined as the mean height of the lower tear prism to the edge of the eye lid measured by the investigator using the Tear scope Plus in conjunction with a Topcon SL-D7 slit lamp biomicroscope and high-resolution digital video recording. Change from Baseline to time (T) T0 (immediately), T15, T30, T60, T120, T180, T240, T300, T360 minutes (mins) after application was reported. A negative change from Baseline (Pre-application) indicates improvement.
measure.population: All participants who met the eligibility criteria, adhered to the protocol, and successfully completed the full study assessment were included in the per-protocol analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis for the outcome measure is the difference in the change from the pre-application value at post-application time (T0) between the intranasal (test) and extranasal (control) applications are zero.
analysis.p_value_desc: Eye-opening, T0: P-value was calculated using 1-sided paired t-test.

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis for the outcome measure is the difference in the change from the pre-application value at post-application time (T15) between the intranasal (test) and extranasal (control) applications are zero.
analysis.p_value_desc: Eye-opening, T15: P-value was calculated using 1-sided paired t-test.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline (Pre-application) in Non-Invasive Tear Film Break-Up Time (NIBUT)
outcome.description: Non-invasive break-up time is the time in seconds between eye opening and the appearance of the first visible break in the lipid layer of the pre-corneal tear film measured by the investigator using the Tearscope Plus in conjunction with a Topcon SL-D7 slit lamp biomicroscope and high-resolution digital video recording. Change from Baseline to T0 (immediately), T15, T30, T60, T120, T180, T240, T300, T360 mins after application was reported. A negative change from Baseline (Pre-application) indicates improvement.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-application (Day 0) to time (T) 0 (immediately), 15, 30, 60, 120, 180, 240, 300 and 360 minutes on Day 0 after application
outcome.population: All participants who met the eligibility criteria, adhered to the protocol, and successfully completed the full study assessment were included in the per-protocol analysis.

outcome.description: The Protected Index (PI) corresponds to the percentage of the corneal surface that is not exposed to the atmosphere (i.e. fully covered by the tear film) over the full interblink period measured by the investigator using a Tear scope Plus in conjunction with a Topcon SL-D7 slit lamp biomicroscope and high-resolution digital video recording. Change from Baseline to T0 (immediately), T15, T30, T60, T120, T180, T240, T300, T360 mins after application was reported.

outcome.title: Change From Pre-application in Exposed Area (EA)
outcome.description: Exposed Area is defined as the percentage of the observed area not covered by the tear film at the time of the blink hence exposed to the atmosphere measured by the investigator using a Tear scope Plus in conjunction with a Topcon SL-D7 slit lamp biomicroscope and high-resolution digital video recording. Change from Baseline to T0 (immediately), T15, T30, T60, T120, T180, T240, T300, T360 mins after application was reported.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-application (Day 0) to time (T) 0 (immediately), 15, 30, 60, 120, 180, 240, 300 and 360 minutes on Day 0 after application
outcome.population: All participants who met the eligibility criteria, adhered to the protocol, and successfully completed the full study assessment were included in the per-protocol analysis.

group.title: TrueTear™ Extranasal Application
group.description: TrueTear™ device, extranasal (control) application, for approximately 3 minutes on Day 0 or Day 14.

group.title: TrueTear™ Intranasal Application
group.description: TrueTear™ device, intranasal (test) application, for approximately 3 minutes on Day 0 or Day 14.

measure.title: Change From Pre-application in Exposed Area (EA)
measure.description: Exposed Area is defined as the percentage of the observed area not covered by the tear film at the time of the blink hence exposed to the atmosphere measured by the investigator using a Tear scope Plus in conjunction with a Topcon SL-D7 slit lamp biomicroscope and high-resolution digital video recording. Change from Baseline to T0 (immediately), T15, T30, T60, T120, T180, T240, T300, T360 mins after application was reported.
measure.population: All participants who met the eligibility criteria, adhered to the protocol, and successfully completed the full study assessment were included in the per-protocol analysis.
measure.units: percentage area not covered by tear film

reported_events.desc: Safety population included all participants that initiated at least one application.

group.title: TrueTear™ Extranasal Application
group.description: TrueTear™ device, extranasal (control) application, for approximately 3 minutes on Day 0 or Day 14.

group.title: TrueTear™ Intranasal Application
group.description: TrueTear™ device, intranasal (test) application, for approximately 3 minutes on Day 0 or Day 14.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
